page.title: 12Quarry Wildlife
page.content: Birds such as crows, blackbirds, owls and kestrels all make nests in the quarry right next to my house. This makes it a wonderful place for birdwatchers. The problem with birdwatchers is that when a pair of kestrels came to nest a few years ago people climbed down the quarry to get a better look at them and frightened the birds away. There used to be little owls in the quarry but the birdwatchers scared them away too. People come from all over the country to look for rare birds on Portland. A lot of bunnies live in the quarries too and I can see them and their burrows from my bedroom if I use binoculars. Snakes such as adders and grass snakes also live in the quarries but they are not seen very often, not unless the day has been very warm. Verity Hymas, aged 11
